title: Duane 'Dog' Chapman denies dating after wife's death saying 'sex is in the past'
text:

Duane 'Dog the Bounty Hunter' Chapman has spoken about life since his wife Beth died and has denied looking to date again.

The 66-year-old has admitted that he has struggled to adjust since Beth passed away, aged 51, after losing her battle with throat cancer.

The reality TV star revealed that sex 'is a thing of the past' as he tries to rebuild his life.

It has been nearly four months since Beth died and Duane has opened up about adjusting to not having a partner and has said that he is not looking to spark a new romance.

(Image: Youtube)

(Image: Getty Images)

Speaking to People Now on Thursday, Duane said: "When your spouse dies, as a man, I mean as me, so generally probably everybody, you’re released from that obligation of being married."

Duane revealed that he wasn't looking for anyone to 'replace' Beth.

He continued: "So your mind and you go crazy. And then after a while, you realise that never will no one ever love me as much as she did.

(Image: Getty Images)

"And I will probably never love anyone else as much as I loved her."

With dating on the back burner at the moment, Duane added that the thought of 'getting physical' with someone is now well and truly confined to memory.

He continued: "Sex is a thing like almost in the past right now. I’m not having it and I don’t care. It’s weird.”

Beth died on June 26 after being diagnosed with stage II throat cancer in September 2017.

description: Dog the Bounty Hunter has admitted that life is not getting any easier as he struggles to adapt since Beth's passing
